intro: Leandra hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
